title: (x) Project Hardcore - Marcelduchamp {Yves}
content:
Hi all   
   
Can anyone help me id'ing the Title font at [http://www.project-hardcore.be](http://web.archive.org/web/20080623194028/http:/www.project-hardcore.be/) ?   
   
I need to do some artwork for this client, and they have no idea what font is used on their previous flyers etc. The printers office got the designs in tiff format so no luck finding a name there either.   
   
Any help would be greatly appreciated!

 [‹ (x) Wutangcorp.com - Zero Twos {Grant}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080623194028/http:/www.typophile.com/node/2234 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Moriah Films - Mantinia CC, Goudy Old Style {Eduardo} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080623194028/http:/www.typophile.com/node/2232 "Go to next forum topic")
author: promotype

comments.content:
Looks like ' [Misproject](http://web.archive.org/web/20080623194028/http:/www.misprintedtype.com/type/type_misproject.html)', by [Eduardo Refice](http://web.archive.org/web/20080623194028/http:/www.misprintedtype.com/)..   
( [www.misprintedtype.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080623194028/http:/www.misprintedtype.com/) )   
   
( Sorry, No, Thats not the one, but maybe a nice alternative nonetheless.. )

Although it looks similar, im afraid it's not the one. I already tried What the font, but it didn't come up with any match.   
   
My client told me the designer that did that site had bought it so if he's telling the truth, it should be a commercial font aswell.   
   
Thanks for trying though ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20080623194028im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
Mike, why not contact the folks at Misproject type and have them recreate something simular for you. They do commercial projects.

Hi Mike, I believe you're looking for Marcelduchamp   
by Fabrizio Gilardino, available through [2Rebels](http://web.archive.org/web/20080623194028/http:/www.2rebels.com/site.html).   
It's yours for $50. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20080623194028im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

I propose the previous title of this thread...   
   
Project Hardcore Font ID   
   
...be the name of a new band featuring Tiffany W. on vocals,   
Eduardo on percussion, Yves drummin', Hubner on glockenspiel,   
Chesh on bass, Grant on guitar, and me on occasional toy piano.   
   
Who did I forget? Care to be managers, Joe and Jared?
Got room for a second guitar there, Stephen? ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20080623194028im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
Only if you wear those red specs.
Somebody else be on bass -- I'd have to be on clarinet. Or backup vocals.
The red specs were stolen from the dressing room at a concert some 3 years ago. ![:-(](http://web.archive.org/web/20080623194028im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/sad.gif)
Clarinet it is! When you're not tooting you can accompany Tiff.
Can I play triangle? I have a lot of money invested into my triangles.

Projecthardcorefontid, Making the Band.. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20080623194028im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
Only, On Typophile..
Good gracious, you guys are all even more insane than I am!

_\> [...] as they cope with fame and stardom in Beverly Hills._   
   
Hmmm... I could live with that. Does it involve loads of   
money, wild parties and copious amounts of drugs?   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080623194028im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/rofl.gif)

haha   
   
thanks yves and all of the others who helped on this! much appreciated!
